title: JS Tech Talk: Scaling a Codebase from a Hacky Project to a Professional Product
details:
Details
-------

We're BACK with a JS Tech-Talk!

Our next topic: Scaling A Codebase from Hacky Project to Professional product

How are your personal projects different from larger commercial codebases? What kind of patterns can we use to build a product at scale?

This talk covers how the Voiceflow codebase (React + NodeJS) has changed from the earliest monolith MVP to 150+ repo project worked on by dozens of people. Tyler Han will provide practical examples of Javascript design patterns and coding practices throughout that have helped clean and improve our code.

Speaker Bio:  
Tyler is the CTO at Voiceflow. To the dismay of his parents, dropped out from UofT Computer Science to be a startup founder - taking Voiceflow from concept to series A. Loves to burn the midnight oil to solve interesting problems or crush infuriating bugs.

Twitter: @VoiceflowHQ  
LinkedIn: [https://www.linkedin.com/in/decathect/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/decathect/)  
Github: DecathectZero

This talk is open to all skill levels.

Code of conduct is enforced at all TorontoJS events [https://torontojs.com/p/code\_of\_conduct](https://torontojs.com/p/code_of_conduct)

Timetable:

6:30 - Intro. Talk Starts

7:30 - End : Socializing and networking.
